definitions.title: Hooke's Law
definitions.definition: The restoring force is directly proportional to the extension, provided the limit of proportionality is not exceeded.

definitions.title: Elastic Deformation
definitions.definition: When the load is removed the material will return to its original length/shape. The material may or may not follow Hooke's law.

definitions.title: Plastic Deformation
definitions.definition: The material is extendable but does not follow Hooke's law, any extension is permanent.

definitions.spec: 4.1.3 Limit of Proportionality Vs Elastic limit
definitions.title: The Limit Of Proportionality
definitions.definition: The point to which Hooke's law applies.

definitions.spec: 4.1.3 Limit of Proportionality Vs Elastic limit
definitions.title: The Elastic Limit
definitions.definition: The point after which the material will be permanently extended when unloading.

definitions.title: Stress
definitions.definition: The amount of force applied to a solid over a given area.

definitions.title: Strain
definitions.definition: The ratio of extension to original length.

definitions.title: Boyle's Law
definitions.definition: For a fixed mass of gas at constant temperature, the volume is inversely proportional to the applied pressure.

definitions.title: Charles Law
definitions.definition: For a fixed mass of gas at constant pressure, the volume is directly proportional to the Kelvin temperature.

definitions.title: Gay-Lussac Law
definitions.definition: For a fixed mass of gas at constant volume, the pressure is directly proportional to the Kelvin temperature.

definitions.title: Internal Energy - For a real gas
definitions.definition: The sum of the potential and kinetic energy for its molecules.

definitions.title: Internal Energy - For an ideal gas
definitions.definition: The sum of the kinetic energy for its molecules.

definitions.title: Absolute Zero
definitions.definition: The temperature at which all molecular motion stops approx -273.16°C (for calculations -273°C is sufficient).

definitions.title: Specific Heat Capacity
definitions.definition: The quantity of heat energy needed to rise the temperature of 1kg of the material by 1k.

definitions.title: Angular Velocity
definitions.definition: The angle turned through over the time taken.

definitions.title: Simple Harmonic Motion (SHM)
definitions.definition: If an object's acceleration is directly proportional to its displacement from its rest position and is always directed towards that position then it is undergoing simple harmonic motion.

definitions.title: Free vibration
definitions.definition: Anything that is vibrating without an external driving force. It will oscillate at its natural frequency.

definitions.title: Natural Frequency
definitions.definition: This is the frequency that an oscillator will vibrate at when allowed to freely oscillate. Denoted as $$f_o$$.

definitions.title: Forced Oscillation
definitions.definition: A vibration that is being made to happen by an external driving force.

definitions.title: Driving frequency
definitions.definition: The frequency of the application of the force in a forced oscillation.

definitions.title: Resonance
definitions.definition: The phenomenon that occurs when the driving frequency is equal to the natural frequency. This leads to the maximum of transfer of energy into the system.

definitions.title: Light damping
definitions.definition: This is when the oscillation comes to rest but performs a negative displacement in the process.

definitions.title: Critical damping
definitions.definition: The oscillation comes to rest without oscillating in the fastest possible time, given by $$\frac{T}{4}$$.

definitions.title: Heavy / Over damping
definitions.definition: The oscillation comes to rest without oscillating in a time greater than $$\frac{T}{4}$$.

definitions.title: Half life
definitions.definition: The time taken for the activity/no. of undecayed radioactive nuclei/current measured on a geiger tube circuit measuring a radioactive substance to fall to half of its original value.
